edu.gvsu.scis.cis350

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gvsu.scis.cis350.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls the board.
    Author:
    Brendan Dent, Casey Zimmerman, Caitlin Crowe

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Model()
      This constructor makes and fills a board when called.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean anyMovesLeft()
      This method checks if player has any valid moves left.
      void changeTurn()
      This method changes whose turn it is.
      int[] countPieces()
      This method counts the total number of empty spaces, black pieces, and white pieces on the board and returns the numbers in results[].
      void fillBoard()
      This method makes all spaces empty, then puts the appropriate pieces in the correct starting positions.
      Piece[][] getBoard()
      This method returns the board.
      int getBoardSize()
      This method returns the size of the board.
      Piece getPlayer()
      This method returns the current player.
      boolean isGameOver()
      This method checks if the game is over by checking for valid moves.
      boolean isValidMove(int x, int y)
      This method checks if the current player placing a piece at x, y is a valid move.
      Piece[][] makeBoard()
      This method makes a new height x width board.
      void makeEndGame1()
      Makes board into a configuration where white wins, there are no more valid moves and there are empty spaces.
      void makeEndGame2()
      Makes board where all pieces are black (not actually achievable).
      void makeEndGame3()
      Makes board where half is black and half is white (probably not actually achievable in this configuration).
      boolean placePiece(int x, int y)
      This method checks if the player can place a piece at the given location and if they can, it places the piece and performs all necessary flips.
      void print()
      This method prints the board to the screen.
      void setBoard(Piece[][] b)
      This method sets board equal to a new value.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        This constructor makes and fills a board when called.

    • Method Detail

      • print

        public final void print()
        This method prints the board to the screen.

      • makeBoard

        public final Piece[][] makeBoard()
        This method makes a new height x width board.
        Returns:
        board This returns the new board

      • fillBoard

        public final void fillBoard()
        This method makes all spaces empty, then puts the appropriate pieces in the correct starting positions.

      • placePiece

        public final boolean placePiece(int x,
                                int y)
        This method checks if the player can place a piece at the given location and if they can, it places the piece and performs all necessary flips.
        Parameters:
        x - This is the horizontal position of piece to be placed
        y - This is the vertical position of piece to be placed
        Returns:
        This returns true if the move was completed successfully

      • isValidMove

        public final boolean isValidMove(int x,
                                 int y)
        This method checks if the current player placing a piece at x, y is a valid move.
        Parameters:
        x - This is the horizontal position of place to check
        y - This is the vertical position of place to check
        Returns:
        This returns true if the move would be valid

      • isGameOver

        public final boolean isGameOver()
        This method checks if the game is over by checking for valid moves.
        Returns:
        This returns true if game is over, false if not

      • anyMovesLeft

        public final boolean anyMovesLeft()
        This method checks if player has any valid moves left.
        Returns:
        This returns true if player has any moves left

      • changeTurn

        public final void changeTurn()
        This method changes whose turn it is.

      • getPlayer

        public final Piece getPlayer()
        This method returns the current player.
        Returns:
        player This is the current player

      • countPieces

        public final int[] countPieces()
        This method counts the total number of empty spaces, black pieces, and white pieces on the board and returns the numbers in results[].
        Returns:
        results index 0 is # of blank spaces, index 1 is # of black pieces, index 2 is # of white pieces.

      • makeEndGame1

        public final void makeEndGame1()
        Makes board into a configuration where white wins, there are no more valid moves and there are empty spaces.

      • makeEndGame2

        public final void makeEndGame2()
        Makes board where all pieces are black (not actually achievable).

      • makeEndGame3

        public final void makeEndGame3()
        Makes board where half is black and half is white (probably not actually achievable in this configuration).

      • getBoard

        public final Piece[][] getBoard()
        This method returns the board.
        Returns:
        board This is the current board

      • setBoard

        public final void setBoard(Piece[][] b)
        This method sets board equal to a new value.
        Parameters:
        b - This is the new value that board will be equal to

      • getBoardSize

        public final int getBoardSize()
        This method returns the size of the board.
        Returns:
        size This is the size of the board
